encountermod:Encounter.NAME: Fated Encounter
DESCRIPTIONS: The black beast clamps its jaws down on its prey's throat, until it stops struggling and goes limp. Suddenly, it sees a flash of gold, a creature it has never seen before on the wastes. Under the sun, the strange creature's mane shines, its fangs and claws powerful. Curious, the black beast puts down the prey, locks eyes with the creature, and...
Thousands of years later, the different races have become indistinguishable. Cooperation is how both sides can win—this is what everyone agrees on.
When Sarkaz kill their prey, their prey's descendants will kill the Sarkaz in return. Kill or be killed, a third option does not exist on Terra.

In that moment, the Teekaz hears an earnest wish: the creature before it desires to end its hunger. The Teekaz grants this wish, offering its prey to the beast, which then dies from overindulgence, becoming the Teekaz's meal. Sadly, those who followed only remembered the Teekaz granting wishes. They wished and wished, until both they and the Teekaz met their ruin.

As time passed, both sides realized that such a stalemate was meaningless and began to develop separately. Now in Kazdel, there is even a group of people so idle that they can tell stories to Revenants by the Furnace.
Storms rage and crystals scatter; the Teekaz and the Elders evade the Catastrophe, as they would for thousands of years to come. On this land, only suffering and death endure.
And so, it would be a few more days later before the fated encounter between the Teekaz and the Elders.
OPTIONS: [Runs away with its prey in its jaws]Leave

encountermod:EpochalRevision.NAME: Epochal Revision
DESCRIPTIONS: "Look, this is one of the many tomes that the Sarkaz has written to hold their prophecies. Let's see, destroyed homeland, cruel enemies, the usual stuff... Wait, these are unlucky incidents... that all happened to me recently?! Could this book be foretelling my fate? I wonder if I can change my luck if I did some revisions..."
"...And I won't go hungry anymore. The end!"
"...And I got a great fortune. The end!"
"...And I blessed with all-around good luck. The end!"
"Best not add anything! What's so bad about a little misfortune?"
OPTIONS: [I'm not willing to be at the mercy of prophecy] Leave

encountermod:Lost And Found.NAME: Lost and Found
DESCRIPTIONS: The hunter is now the hunted. Shambling through the silver mounts, each step brings him closer to death. But amidst the relentless metallic onslaught, something seems destined to lead him out of this lethal peril, and that something is—

The hunter takes the strange object and continues deeper into the mountain range... NL —The artifact you place down instantly changes into another, and the story jumps forward thousands of years. The one that completed the exchange for you, the Sa... the Teekaz is none other than Farchaser, the first King of Sarkaz.
The Hunter suddenly understood the way out. NL You decide to let go of this storyline and explore other possibilities instead.
The Hunter chose to retrace his steps to the last fork in the path, ready to make a different choice.
The damaged metal device failed to ignite flames, thus allowing the Hunter to venture deeper into the mountains unharmed.
You decide to abandon this narrative thread and construct a new starting point.

encountermod:Inauguration Ceremony.NAME: Inauguration Ceremony
DESCRIPTIONS: Night descends swiftly, and a hot wind stirs ashes and torn page fragments. Tonight marks the first night since Kazdel ascended into the sky. The bare soil bears no trace of the city, only hundreds of glowing iron barrels scattered across the landscape. You see Sarkaz engineers throwing stacks of blueprints into the flames. Some of the engineers cast wary glances behind you. Turning around, you face a group of ominous outlanders. An engineer on watch demands to know why you're here, and you respond—

When the engineers hear you're here for the seminar, they relax and point you the way. "We have friends of all races to thank for Kazdel's ascent. This design seminar is to share our experiences with everyone as a token of gratitude." You follow the outlanders—who were actually lost—to the event venue and take many notes. This knowledge will certainly be useful in the future.
N/A
The engineers enjoyed chatting with you. At parting, they gave your team a small gift.
The discussion broadened your perspective, and you offered them corrections. In thanks, they paid you a nominal "patent fee".
N/A
You wanted nothing to do with them and left without a word.
OPTIONS: [Catastrophe Is Coming] Fight against the Catastrophe.

encountermod:Big Fish.NAME: Big Fish
DESCRIPTIONS: As you thought this, the items suddenly sank lower, and you scooped them all up.

encountermod:The Cleric.NAME: The Cleric
DESCRIPTIONS: Twin beams of icy blue and golden warmth enveloped you, then dissipated. NL The creature grinned: "A cleric can do anything. Well then, good luck out there!"

encountermod:Golden Idol.NAME: Golden Idol
DESCRIPTIONS: You wished to it for more riches, yet the Golden Idol shattered abruptly. NL Knowing traps lay ahead, you gathered only the portion of gold within your reach.

encountermod:Shining Light.NAME: Shining Light
DESCRIPTIONS: You stepped into the light, noticing its radiance being absorbed into your very body. NL The light burned with scalding heat! Yet the pain vanished as swiftly as it came. NL You felt invigorated—like receiving a sharp slap to the face when you needed waking. Even your inspiration surged.

encountermod:Golden Wing.NAME: Wing Statue
DESCRIPTIONS: @CAAAAW@ NL You couldn't help but shout, as if the cry itself lent you strength. NL Once the echoes faded, you found a dagger embedded in your wing. Pulling it out, the blade gleamed wickedly sharp.

encountermod:Scrap Ooze.NAME: Scrap Ooze
DESCRIPTIONS: Suddenly you noticed a bracelet by its mouth. You picked it up first, hoping to avoid further conflict down the road. NL Turning back to look, the creature appeared to have fully absorbed its meal.

encountermod:World of Goop.NAME: World of Goop
DESCRIPTIONS: You seemed to grasp its demand. Placing a card on the ground, you watched the goop gobble it up before vanishing. NL Then you scooped up every last #yGold left behind.
OPTIONS: [Locked] Requires: card with Rarity higher than Uncommon.
[Locked] Requires: card with Rarity higher than Common.

encountermod:Beggar.NAME: Old Beggar
DESCRIPTIONS: The beggar suddenly cast off his coat—revealing himself as the Cleric! NL "What a kind soul you are! Let me offer you counsel!" he cried out. NL "Here, the more intently you think of something, the more likely it manifests!" NL As you pondered his words, they resonated with your past experiences—there was truth in them.

encountermod:Back to Basics.NAME: Ancient Writing
DESCRIPTIONS: Creation births all things.

encountermod:Nest.NAME: The Nest
DESCRIPTIONS: #r~"MURDER!!~ #r~MURDER~ #r~MURDER!!"~ NL #b~"CAW~ #b~CAW~ #b~CAW~ #b~CAW!!"~ NL The cultists die one by one, and you notice the dagger glinted with cold light.
The spiral of hatred began, plunging all past the point of no return.

encountermod:The Joust.NAME: The Joust
DESCRIPTIONS: Everything unfolded just as you'd envisioned—your gamble paid off. NL As you claimed the coins, a wave of ~dizziness~ washed over you, your head growing heavy.

encountermod:The Library.NAME: The Library
DESCRIPTIONS: You set out to find a specific book... NL Following this thread of thought, you located the very tome in no time. NL

encountermod:The Mausoleum.NAME: The Mausoleum
DESCRIPTIONS: You knelt on the ground, visualizing the life of the deceased... NL Aha—not bad at all! You can weave this into a story later.

encountermod:Colosseum.NAME: The Colosseum
DESCRIPTIONS: While all eyes were locked on the opponent, you slipped away clean.

encountermod:Falling.NAME: Falling
DESCRIPTIONS: As the thought settled, you touched down unscathed.

encountermod:MindBloom.NAME: Mind Bloom
DESCRIPTIONS: Right—what was I hesitating for?

encountermod:SecretPortal.NAME: Secret Portal
DESCRIPTIONS: You reached in and rummaged through the void. Moments later, you retrieved a relic.
Stepping through the portal, you found yourself in an alien world. NL An Anasa sat cross-legged there. He was greatly astonished to see you and very friendly invited you to debate with him.
OPTIONS: [I sense it can help me!] 1 Idea: #gObtain #ga #grandom #gRare #grelic.
[I sense it leads beyond the world itself!] 2 Idea: Fight with special enemy.

encountermod:Tomb of Lord Red Mask.NAME: Tomb of Lord Red Mask
DESCRIPTIONS: You think you did good thing.
OPTIONS: [Locked] Requires: card with damage not less than 15.

encountermod:Fountain of Cleansing.NAME: The Divine Fountain
DESCRIPTIONS: You used this water to thoroughly wash your face. Now you feel refreshed.
Choose 1 Curse to remove

encountermod:Accursed Blacksmith.NAME: Ominous Forge
DESCRIPTIONS: You took out an empty bottle and placed it by the Furnace. Closing your eyes, you wished for good luck. NL Suddenly, you felt hard thumps—like being hit by a hammer. Then came loud @CLANK!@ @CLANK!@ @CLANK!@ sounds. Your mind felt clearer. Opening your eyes, you saw the bottle filled with red liquid.
